meanings.sent1: The government decided to subsidize the new small businesses in the town.
meanings.sent2: Many charities subsidize education for underprivileged children.
meanings.sent3: The generous donation helped subsidize the community center's renovation.
meanings.sent4: Her part-time job subsidizes her passion for painting.
meanings.sent5: The scholarship will subsidize your college tuition fees.

meanings.sent1: The organization plans to subsidize farmers affected by the drought.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to subsidize public transportation to reduce traffic congestion.
meanings.sent3: The company's decision to subsidize employee meals was met with gratitude.
meanings.sent4: The discount will subsidize the cost of your purchase.
meanings.sent5: The grant will subsidize the research project on renewable energy.

meanings.definition: To assist or promote with a subsidy
meanings.sent1: The foundation aims to subsidize healthcare initiatives in rural areas.
meanings.sent2: The scholarship program helps subsidize students' academic pursuits.
meanings.sent3: The local government decided to subsidize the construction of new playgrounds.
meanings.sent4: The grant will subsidize the development of innovative technologies.
meanings.sent5: The subsidy will subsidize the cost of attending the conference.
